Name: Marilith
DamageResistances:
bludgeoning,	
piercing,	and	slashing	from	nonmagical	attacks

Traits.Name: Magic	Resistance
Traits.Content:
The	marilith	has	advantage	on	
saving	throws	against	spells	and	other	magical	effects.

Traits.Name: Magic Weapons
Traits.Content:
The	marilith’s	weapon	attacks	are	
magical.

Traits.Name: Reactive
Traits.Content:
The	marilith	can	take	one	reaction	on	every	
turn	in	a	combat.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content:
The	marilith	makes	seven	attacks:	six	with	
its	longswords	and	one	with	its	tail

Actions.Name: Longsword
Actions.Content:
Melee	Weapon	Attack: +9	to	hit,	reach	5	ft.,	
one	target.	Hit: 13	(2d8	+	4)	slashing	damage.

Actions.Name: Tail
Actions.Content:
Melee	Weapon	Attack: +9	to	hit,	reach	10	ft.,	one	
creature.	Hit:	15	(2d10	+	4)	bludgeoning	damage.	If	the	
target	is	Medium	or	smaller,	it	is	grappled	(escape	DC	
19).	Until this	grapple	ends,	the	target	is	restrained,	the	
marilith	can	automatically	hit	the	target	with	its	tail,	
and	the	marilith	can’t	make	tail	attacks	against	other	
targets.

Actions.Name: Teleport
Actions.Content:
The	marilith	magically	teleports,	along	with	
any	equipment	it	is	wearing	or carrying,	up	to	120	feet	
to	an	unoccupied	space	it	can	see.

Reactions.Name: Parry
Reactions.Content:
The	marilith	adds	5	to	its	AC	against	one	melee	
attack	that	would	hit	it.	To	do	so,	the	marilith	must	see	
the	attacker	and	be	wielding	a	melee	weapon.
